basics.name: Jeremy Collins
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: Product engineer & general enthusiast for web technology.

work.name: Webflow
work.summary:
- Member of the Grow & Extend team, responsible for user onboarding, activation, and other early stages of the user journey working with Full-stack TypeScript, React, Express, MongoDB
- Implemented numerous growth-focused experiments of varying size and scope where the developer is the DRI, each with an A/B testing rollout plan, analytics dashboards, and statistical analysis to determine the winning variant
- Launched Webflow's first AI tooling in 2023, after being a part of a successful internal hackathon to develop the feature
- Played a lead role in establishing an analytics pipeline incorporating cube.js and ClickHouse OLAP DBMS to visualize and alert users of their website traffic usage milestones

work.name: MasterClass
work.summary:
- Front-end developer on Growth team, focused on UX of payments and promotions
- Transitioned select pre-paywall pages from Rails-served client-side React pages to to NextJS (powered by a Rails API) 
- Responsible for deploying and accurately maintaining A/B test experiments using Optimizely or in-house user testing systems

work.name: HITRECORD
work.summary:
- Lead role in re-launching the web experience as a new Angular webapp on top of the existing Rails codebase, utilizing Redux (NgRx), RxJS, XState
- Developed e-learning lesson system models, API, and interfaces, with an admin-facing custom CMS
- Merger with MasterClass in April 2022

work.name: Plink
work.summary:
- Full-stack TypeScript / JavaScript role, encompassing numerous React SPA and Node projects (for API creation or React SSR)
- Implemented an asset library feature where users can browse and download files, involving multiple node-based applications backing the React front-end
- Transitioned the existing JavaScript codebases to TypeScript and took charge of numerous related major dependency updates

work.name: Event Farm
work.summary:
- Modernized and fully rewrote the front-end codebase to Angular 2+ single-page app, while still supporting the older AngularJS+jQuery web-app
- Lead UX overhaul of Angular-based ticket management system
- Once the primary app was mature, created a WYSIWYG web page builder as one of platform features using React & Vue. Included support for creating responsive-design webpages plus creating or saving templates

work.name: Act-On Software, Inc.
work.summary:
- Transitioned to full-time engineer on the Content & Delivery team, responsible for the WYSIWYG email, form, and webpage builders used by customers. 
- Rapidly acclimated to a very large Java and AngularJS-based enterprise web application codebase, after previously working only on smaller website projects 
- Implemented features to the email and form designer products, such as adding responsive design support for user-created wysiwyg editor content

work.name: Act-On Software, Inc.
work.summary:
- Acted as a “white-glove” professional services, and developer relations
- Designed custom webpages, graphic designs, and scripts for interactive elements

work.name: Electronic Arts (EA)
work.summary: - Created marketing and in-game asset art for the Facebook web-app games developed by EA Capital Games

education.studyType: Bachelor of Arts in Communication and Political Science

projects.name: Codable
projects.summary: Codable is an iOS app that allows local debugging or visual changes to be made to a website while on mobile. This is done by heavily leveraging the iOS WebKit JavaScript APIs to query the loaded webpage or direct changes, while displaying data to the user in a native Swift interface.
